Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the effectiveness of a baking soda remedy in eliminating COVID-19 deaths in Israel.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that Israel has reported COVID-19 deaths.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to prove its effectiveness.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that mixing lemon and bicarbonate can provide immunity from COVID-19 infections without any scientific basis.
Understate: There is no evidence to support the claim that the baking soda remedy has any effect on COVID-19 disease, suggesting that the claim may be understating the seriousness of the virus.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations or treatments that have been scientifically proven to prevent or cure COVID-19.
